verbose_text: In contrast to the observation that pharmacological blockade of beta-adrenergic receptors does not affect electrically induced LTP at mf-CA3 and Schaffer collateral-CA1 synapses in vivo, in rodent hippocampal slices, plasticity that is solely induced by electrical stimulation is sensitive to pharmacological modulation of beta-adrenergic receptors, both in Schaffer collateral-CA1 and mf-CA3 synapses.
evidence: modulation of beta-adrenergic receptors, both in Schaffer collateral-CA1
